TopicTitle: I'm bored. I need some inspiration.

Articles.Content: Just like the title says. Whenever I start a new rocket, for one reason or another, I get rid of it. I really need some inspiration. Can anyone point me toward a half-decent rocket company or vehicle?

Have you tried planes? I like to go back and forth or burn out too fast. Nothing cures boredom like a nice flight around Kerbin.

I also find I enjoy sharing my planes with others more, so I design more of them. Part of that is how easy it is to slap a rocket together, but when you spend all the time perfecting a plane, you want others to see it.
Huh... I like that. I'll try to build a plane and take a nice flight around Kerbin.

Huh... I like that. I'll try to build a plane and take a nice flight around Kerbin.

I like to fly over to the mountains at night and do stupid stuff there when I am bored.

Try buzzing the tower. If you're successful, try it closer. Then closer...then asymptotically closer.

Bonus points if you destroy the SPH. Bonus JEBEDIAH points if your pilot(s) survive(s) without parachutes.
Yeah, planes are good for when you want to have some fun flying around, but don't want that whole launch-orbit-transfer-land procedure... I just build new bomber designs

Alternatively, you could do something ambitious on the scale of the proposed Mars Direct mission (ie. build a long-term base on Duna and return to Kerbin once the two planets are properly aligned again). Maybe even add in a few difficulty-enhancing mods like TAC Life Support, Ferram Aerospace Research, perhaps Deadly Re-Entry and RemoteTech as well.

I have tried for literally almost a year to convince bored KSP'ers to build a replica moai statue out of structural panels and land it on the island with the old runway. For some reason, no one ever does
Try a challenge or two - I know that helps get me out of my rut.
Wait, What is a "moia statue"?

Wait, What is a "moia statue"?

The heads from easter island.
Moai
Bored? Go reusable. That will keep you busy for awhile...
Do you need a launch vehicle or a complete spacecraft? I have some sleek stock launch vehicles with fairings that can lift up to 135 tonnes.

Build a Laythe colony. Then another. Include SSTO jets to ferry Kerbals around and rovers. Maybe include small boats to explore the seas. You should probably put a station in orbit as well as a return vehicle capable of getting everyone home again.

before the career version I started creating a leisure company. It consisted of a SSTO which could take a detachable hitch hiker can up in to a space hotel in LKO. It was designed at the time so the tourists didn't have to leave the can at all. I then had a ferry which would take them over to mun and minmus where their hitch hiker can could dock with a pad on the ground next to a munbase - I was planning a duna base as well as a large passenger ferry to take them out there and back. I was also planning on making a luxury resort on Laythe and have a ferry system to a port in low laythe orbit with ssto's which would shuttle the tourists down to the resort. Then career came out and I abandoned the idea - but I'm always planing to pick it up again once I get enough kerbal funds to start it up again.

Bored? Play something else until that new idea flashes into your head. Return to KSP and have some real fun. Fun and excitement cannot be forced.

I'm discovering that the most fun thing to build in KSP are replicas.

Try to recreate your favorite RL missions or craft. Its very satisfying.

I'm currently starting a new space program in which I am trying to create a self-sufficient base and construction site on most planets (Using Kethane and Extraplanetary launchpads). So far I am prototyping single-launch advance base/construction ships on the mun, that can expand upon themselves when landed.

This little project got me back into KSP pretty well.
